Vibrational Frequencies

IQmol can be used to visualize vibrational frequncies by either animation or by displaying the displacement vectors associated with a normal mode. In order to display these, IQmol needs the output from a frequency calculation.

Visualization of the vibrations is controlled via the Vibrational Frequencies window, which can be opened by double clicking the Frequencies layer in the Model View. If the output has been read correctly a window similar to the following will appear:

The displacement vectors for the selected mode are displayed by default. Modes can be selected by either directly clicking on them, pushing the and buttons, or by using the arrow keys on the keyboard. The amplitude slider can be used to scale the vectors to the desired size.

A mode can also be animated by either selecting it and clicking the button, or by simply double clicking the mode on the list. The amplitude and speed of the motion can be controlled via their respective sliders.

Note

  • Very small displacement vectors are not displayed for clarity. To see these the amplitude slider should be increased to enlarge the scale of the vectors.
